home.content: # The Last One. --- Congratulations! We are done.

slide2.content:
# Recap
---
Here's a quick recap of our class.

slide3.content:
# Topics Covered
--- 

Yo what did we learneds?

## Basics

1. Guts of Network request
2. HTML and CSS basics
100. Pushing webpages to the interwebs

slide4.content:
# Topics Covered
--- 

## Layout and Markup

3. Semantic HTML and how to use
4. CSS3, layouts and grids
11. Frontend Frameworks
10. Positioning!

slide5.content:
# Topics Covered
--- 

## Programming

5. JavaScript basics
6. Functions / Returns
7. Arrays and loops
8. Objects
9. jQuery and events
10. Using web APIs

slide6.content:
# Letter of Completion
---

In order to receive a letter of completion, you will need...

## Requirements

* 80% homework completion
* 80% attendance
* Final project submission

slide7.content:
# Letter of Completion
---

In a few weeks, you'll get an email with a letter that states you've completed this course. This is **not** a certification. Also, in tech **certifications** are effectively meaningless. **BUT**, if your company requires some sort of documentation for reimbursement, this should be valid.

slide8.content: # Next Steps --- What's next? ## Perks * [Alumni Perks](https://generalassemb.ly/alumni/perks) * [GA Events](https://generalassemb.ly/education?format=events) * [GA NYC Alumni Group](https://www.facebook.com/gnrlassembly/)

slide9.content:
# Next Steps
---

## Learning

* Keep **practicing**.
* Built a badass final project? Cool. Build something else. Learn **[firebase](https://www.firebase.com/)**, **[react](https://facebook.github.io/react/)**, **[node](http://nodeschool.io/).**

slide10.content:
# Next Steps
---

Most importantly tho: **KEEP. BUILDING. THINGS.**

## Resources

* [Free Code Camp](https://www.freecodecamp.com/)
* [Code Wars](https://www.codewars.com/)

slide11.content:
# Next Steps
---

## Community

I run a personal slack channel for my former students who are actively looking to transition into a software engineering career. Hit me up and I'll add you!

Also, you are **all** welcome to audit any future GA Class / Workshop I teach from now til Infinity. **[Check out my page](https://generalassemb.ly/instructors/taq-karim/1667)** for updates on future classes I may teach.

slide12.content:
# Survey
---

Please take some time now to fill out your End of Course Surveys! They should be in your email.

Some light music courtesy of DJ Zach will be playing in the background...


## [G.O.O.D. Musicz](https://play.spotify.com/user/1212575832/playlist/3PXJQfW2Zv878sp02smcfA?play=true&utm_source=open.spotify.com&utm_medium=open)

slide13.content: # Presentations --- Ok, game time! **Presentation Guidelines** 0. Come up to this machine. 1. Click on your project below to open it up. 2. Demo the general gist of your project - click around and show folks what it does and how it works, etc. 4. Speak a little bit towards what tech you used, what problems you ran into, etc. Aaaaand now...
